title: What pickups would get the Green Day sound? - Quora

response.answer_text: Basically…all of them. They’ve used humbuckers, single-coils, P90s, and lipstick tube PUs. But more than likely their “signature sound” is probably leaning toward an angled Seymour Duncan SH-4 JB in the bridge position. Most passive humbuckers would get you pretty damn close. You’re going to want to dial in your sound with the right amp. Armstrong has relied heavily on a modified Marshall, so it’s anything but an off-the-shelf amp’s sound. On the other hand he’s also used a Fender Bassman, so…

Seymour Duncan JB for early Green Day, and Gibson P90 for later Green Day. The amp matters, too. In the studio, Billie Joe Armstrong uses a cranked Fender Tweed Deluxe amplifier if I remember correctly. Think the tone of ‘American Idiot’ for the P90 + tweed Deluxe sound. If the guitar you’re playing on is routed for humbuckers, you can always install a Phat Cat or similar humbucker-sized P90 pickup and likely get a similar tone.
